required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Local Measures to Prevent Diabetes in the Værnes Region.
clinical_study.official_title: The VEND RISK-study. Preventing Diabetes Type 2 in Overweight Persons in the Værnes Region, Central-Norway.

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: This is a development project involving four different municipalities in Central Norway. The aim is to identify adults with overweight and with an increased risk of developing diabetes mellitus type 2, then to prevent the disease to develop by the means of a behaviour change programme. The programme is group based.

intervention.description: The programme consists of a introductory course, organised physical activity 2-3 times a week, meetings every 3rd month with lectures and theme nights, and organising self-help groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Living in Central Norway
- Find Risc score > 15
- Written, informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe mental disorder
- Not being able to function in the group programme

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian University of Technology and Science

results_reference.citation: Følling IS, Kulseng B, Midthjell K, Rangul V, Helvik AS. Individuals at high risk for type 2 diabetes invited to a lifestyle program: characteristics of participants versus non-participants (the HUNT Study) and 24-month follow-up of participants (the VEND-RISK Study). BMJ Open Diabetes Res Care. 2017 Jul 31;5(1):e000368. doi: 10.1136/bmjdrc-2016-000368. eCollection 2017.
